intro: Ricinus scaber, commonly known as rough castor, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cup-shaped structures called cyathia. Ricinus scaber is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for warm climates.
